text: Sam Moore (born 9 September 1998 in Cardiff, Wales) is a rugby union player who plays Number 8 for Sale Sharks. ==Club career== Moore joined the Sale Sharks Academy in 2016. In July 2017 he was awarded his first professional contract, a five-year deal starting from the 2017-18 season. In October 2017, Moore made his senior debut for Sale Sharks against Lyon in the European Challenge Cup. In January 2020, Moore announced he would be joining the Cardiff Blues from Sale with immediate effect. ==International career== He is the son of former Wales player Steve Moore and the nephew of Andy Moore, who also played for Wales between 1995 and 2002. As his father was born in England, Moore is eligible to play for them in addition to being eligible to play for Wales where he was born. He has elected to play for England at under-16, under-17, under-18 and under-19 level. Moore represented the England U20 side in the 2018 Six Nations Under 20s Championship. He was ruled out of the 2018 World Rugby Under 20 Championship due to injury. In February 2018, Moore was included in the England senior team squad for the first time. Under current World Rugby regulations, Moore remains eligible to play for either the England or Wales senior teams. ==External links== *Sale profile ==References== Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Sale Sharks players Category:Rugby union number eights Category:People educated at Merchant Taylors' School, Crosby Category:People educated at Sedbergh School
title: Sam Moore (rugby union)
